about.title: About This Site
about.summary: This site was built with Angular and .NET Core. It acts as a living showcase of my ability. Expand for a deep dive into the digiverse...
about.detailOne: To be written on completion of the final site archetecture.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.gameDevelopmentDescription:
Game Development was an open ended module with the aim of developing a game demo.
I was placed into a team of 11 with 7 artists and 4 programmers.
The only restriction for the game was that it needed to have soundscapes as the main theme and use the sound library the module leaders provided.
The finished game was a stealth game with platforming elements.
The game was built in Unreal Engine 4.10 and acted as my introduction to building games in an engine instead of from scratch.
portfolio.gameDevelopmentSearchCriteria: game development devlopment devlpment devlpmnt dvlpmnt
portfolio.programming1Description:
Programming 1 acted as my introduction to programming.
The module covered basics from variables and loops up to classes.
The first projects were built in notepad and later projects were built in Visual Studio 2010.
portfolio.programming1SearchCriteria: programming 1 programming one prog 1 prog one prg programing
portfolio.programming2Description:
Programming 2 was a continuation of learning C#.
The module covered abstract data types, polymorphism and finally XNA.
I have linked the XNA solution for this site.
To run the solution you will need both visual studio 2010 and XNA
portfolio.programming2SearchCriteria: programming 2 programming two prog 2 prog two prg programing
portfolio.hangmanDescription:
During the christmas break of university there was a challenge to create a hangman game within XNA.
This was completely optional and done as a joke by Tommy the lecturer.
I completed this over a few weeks in December and made all of the graphics myself.
portfolio.databasesDescription:
The databases module in my university course covered the basics of database design and SQL.
To my memory this was written in MySQL but I have spent the subsequent year working with SQL Server.
I have attached the final assessment for this module.
portfolio.graphics1Description:
Graphics 1 was an introduction to graphics programming with C++ and OpenGL.
The module was split into two assignments.
The first assignment was a 2D GUI. The GUI works as a window opening/resizing programme. I have made some changes to the project so it can be run out of the box but only the release build can load the image files.
The second assignment is a 3D model viewer. The model viewer is a simple viewer which has rotation control.
portfolio.networksAndSecurityDescription:
The networks and security module consisted of mostly theory.
The assessment was split into a paper and a python application.
The files attached are the python application.
portfolio.networksAndSecuritySearchCriteria: networks ntworks netwrks ntwrks and n & nd + security scurity scrity scrty scurty secrity secrty securty
portfolio.graphics2Description:
Graphics 2 was a continuation of 3D rendering shown in Graphics 1.
The rendering used per pixel lighting and code manipulatable shader light sources.
I treated this as an exercise of efficiency.
The source project has issues with libraries so it does not build. When I have a chance later I will fix this so the solution runs out the box.
portfolio.applicationDevelopmentDescription:
Application development was a module based around website development.
There were tutorials for both ASP.NET and PHP in the module but I chose to make the application an ASP.NET application.
The assessment project uses WebGL on a canvas to render a gallery.
The gallery loads custom rooms based off a saved seed.
The intention was to add drawing tools to the rooms for customisation.
Drawing would change the stored seed for the user to match the drawing.
If given the chance I would like to revisit this especially with the new resurgence of virtual reality.
portfolio.applicationDevelopmentSearchCriteria: application development applcation devlopment applction devlpment applcton devlpmnt applctn dvlpmnt
portfolio.teamProjectDescription:
Team project as a module with a loose concept: Build a product within a team.
Our team ended up making a tool which encrypts downloads on google chrome browsers.
The encryption tool was added to the google play store under the name "FluffyPuffin".
portfolio.teamProjectSearchCriteria: team project tem tam tm prject projct prjct
portfolio.systemsProgrammingDescription:
Systems Programming was based around building C++ development for systems without user interaction.
The assessment was to use the DirectSound API to build a music streaming application which has a 4 second rotary buffer for storing the music.
The challenge of this module was wrangling the DirectSound API into working.
I would love to revisit this module in the future; changing the api and changing the streaming method from TCP to UDP.
portfolio.gameBehaviourDescription:
Game Behaviour was a module covering AI and Phsyics in games.
For the assesment I made a game in MonoGame which is a non-microsoft continuation of XNA.
portfolio.independentStudiesDescription:
Independent Studies is the module name for the dissertation in my BSc.
For my dissertation I decided to see if a free-to-play game could use positive actions for currency.
The produced game was put on the google play store under the name EnergyRace and has since been removed.
portfolio.independentStudiesSearchCriteria: independent studies indi indy std dissertations
